qas.question: In what year did Guinea-Bissau start to bring some internal monetary stability to the country?
What did the government do in 1997 to increase monetary stability?

answers.text: entered the CFA franc monetary system

qas.question: What years did the civil war take place?
When was there a military coup in Guinea-Bissau?

context: After several years of economic downturn and political instability, in <a0_0>1997<a0_0/>, Guinea-Bissau <a1_0>entered the CFA franc monetary system<a1_0/>, bringing about some internal monetary stability. The civil war that took place in <a2_0>1998 and 1999<a2_0/>, and a military coup in <a3_0>September 2003<a3_0/> again disrupted economic activity, leaving a substantial part of the economic and social infrastructure in ruins and intensifying the already widespread poverty. Following the parliamentary elections in <a4_0>March 2004<a4_0/> and presidential elections in July 2005, the country is trying to recover from the long period of instability, despite a still-fragile political situation.
